Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for bandwidth, latency, redundancy, and security. Identify the applications and services that will use Azure ExpressRoute.
Design the network architecture, including ExpressRoute circuit placement, peering locations, and integration with existing on-premises and Azure networks.
Choose a connectivity provider that supports Azure ExpressRoute and can meet the required SLA for bandwidth and latency.
Request the LOA from Microsoft for the ExpressRoute service. This document authorizes the connectivity provider to provision the connection.
Create and configure the required ExpressRoute circuits in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Ensure they are provisioned in multiple locations for redundancy.
Submit the LOA to the chosen connectivity provider to initiate the provisioning of the physical connection.
Set up necessary peering configurations, including VLANs, BGP peering, and route filters as per design requirements.
Enable required security measures, such as encryption (e.g., MACsec) on the circuits. Configure cryptographic keys and policies for securing the data link layer.
Deploy Azure VPN Gateway in the corresponding virtual networks if VPN backup is needed. Configure VPN connections as a backup to primary connections.
Configure BGP sessions between the on-premises routers and the Azure ExpressRoute circuits. Ensure proper route advertisement and acceptance policies.
Perform thorough testing of the connectivity, including failover scenarios, throughput tests, and latency measurements to ensure the network meets the required specifications.
Establish redundant ExpressRoute circuits and VPN connections to ensure high availability. Verify that failover mechanisms are functioning correctly.
Apply security best practices such as Network Security Groups (NSGs), Azure DDoS Protection, and access control policies. Ensure proper segmentation of network traffic.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor, Network Watcher, and third-party tools. Configure alerts for circuit status, BGP session drops, and performance metrics.
Document the network architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the setup.
Ensure the setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
